text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement codeofconduct@damurka.com. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Get started with cancerscreening
text: functions directly call KHIS server download data require setting KHIS credentials. See setting credentials information. cancer screening data tracked breast cancer, cervical cancer, colorectal cancer laboratory diagnostic data.

title: Get started with cancerscreening
text: get_cervical_screened(): Downloads data women screened cervical cancer. get_cervical_positive(): Retrieves data women tested positive cervical pre-cancer cancer. get_cervical_treated(): Accesses data women received treatment cervical pre-cancer cancer.

title: Get started with cancerscreening
text: get_breast_cbe(): Downloads data women received CBE breast cancer screening. get_breast_ultrasound(): Downloads data women received ultrasound breast cancer screening. get_breast_mammogram(): Downloads data women received mammograms breast cancer screening.

title: Get started with cancerscreening
text: get_colorectal_fobt(): Retrieves data individuals receive FOBT colorectal cancer screening tests. get_colorectal_colonoscopy(): Retrieves data individuals receive colonoscopy colorectal cancer screening tests.

title: Get started with cancerscreening
text: functions require access KHIS server project calculate target population guided Kenya housing population census 2019 Kenya National Cancer Screening guidelines 2019. functions include: get_cervical_target_population(), get_colorectal_target_population(), get_breast_cbe_target_population() get_breast_mammogram_target_population(). function meet criteria can make target population using get_filtered_population().
code: # Get the cervical screening target population for 2022 cervical_target_population <- get_cervical_target_population(2022) cervical_target_population #> # A tibble: 1 × 2 #>   country   target #>   <chr>      <dbl> #> 1 Kenya   1112735. # Get the colorectal cancer screening target population for 20223 by county colorectal_target_population <- get_colorectal_target_population(2023, level = 'county') colorectal_target_population #> # A tibble: 47 × 3 #> # Groups:   country [1] #>    country county          target #>    <chr>   <fct>            <dbl> #>  1 Kenya   Baringo          8277. #>  2 Kenya   Bomet           10887. #>  3 Kenya   Bungoma         21427. #>  4 Kenya   Busia           12263. #>  5 Kenya   Elgeyo Marakwet  6050. #>  6 Kenya   Embu            12288. #>  7 Kenya   Garissa          6872. #>  8 Kenya   Homa Bay        14163. #>  9 Kenya   Isiolo           2848. #> 10 Kenya   Kajiado         12606. #> # ℹ 37 more rows # Get the population of women 15-49 year for the year 2024 wra_pop <- get_filtered_population(year = 2024, min_age = 15, max_age = 49, pop_sex = 'female') wra_pop #> # A tibble: 1 × 2 #>   country    target #>   <chr>       <dbl> #> 1 Kenya   13023053.

title: Screening Coverage
text: number women screened can obtained get_cervical_screened eligible women can obtained get_cervical_target_population.
code: # Target population by county target_population <- get_cervical_target_population(2023, level = 'county')  # Population screened during the same period screened <- get_cervical_screened('2023-01-01', level = 'county')  # aggregate the screened  screened <- screened %>%   summarise(screened = sum(value, na.rm = TRUE), .by = county)  # merge with the target and calculate the coverage  screened %>%   right_join(target_population, by = 'county') %>%   mutate(coverage = screened / target)

title: Screening Coverage
text: number women screened can obtained get_breast_cbe eligible women can obtained get_breast_cbe_target_population.
code: # Target population by county target_population <- get_breast_cbe_target_population(2023, level = 'county')  # Population screened during the same period screened <- get_breast_cbe('2023-01-01', level = 'county')  # aggregate the screened  screened <- screened %>%   summarise(screened = sum(value, na.rm = TRUE), .by = county)  # merge with the target and calculate the coverage  screened %>%   right_join(target_population, by = 'county') %>%   mutate(coverage = screened / target)

title: Set your credentials
text: Kenya Health Information System (KHIS) comprehensive web-based platform used Kenya data collection, management, analysis healthcare sector. However, need credential access data. cancerscreening make call KHIS without credential provided wrong credential receive unauthorized error KHIS. Preferred method: Provide path JSON file created expected format JSON file Confirm success credential set
code: khis_cred(config_path = "/path/to/the/JSON/file.json") {   "credentials": {     "username": "your-khis-username",     "password": "your-khis-password"   } } khis_has_cred()

title: Set your credentials
text: access JSON file can provide username password directly get username logged users clear password logged users
code: khis_cred(username = 'your_username', password = 'your_password') khis_username() khis_cred_clear()

title: cancerscreening configuration — cancerscreening-configuration
text: cancerscreening_quiet option can used suppress messages form cancerscreening. default, cancerscreening always messages, .e. quiet. set cancerscreening_quiet TRUE suppress message, one means, order decreasing scope: Put options(cancerscreening_quiet = TRUE) start-file, .Rprofile,  R script Use local_cancerscreening_quiet() silence cancerscreening specific scope Use with_cancerscreening_quite run small bit code silently local_cancerscreening_quiet with_cancerscreening follow conventions withr package (https://withr.r-lib.org).

title: cancerscreening configuration — cancerscreening-configuration
code: if (FALSE) {   # message: "The credentials have been set."   khis_cred(username = 'username', password = 'password')    # suppress messages for a small amount of code   with_cancerscreening_quiet(     khis_cred(username = 'username', password = 'password')   ) }  if (FALSE) {   # message: "The credentials have been set."   khis_cred(username = 'username', password = 'password')    # suppress messages for a in a specific scope   local_cancerscreening_quiet()    # no message   khis_cred(username = 'username', password = 'password')    # clear credentials   khis_cred_clear() }

what: cancerscreening: Streamline Access to Cancer Screening Data — cancerscreening-package
title: cancerscreening: Streamline Access to Cancer Screening Data — cancerscreening-package
text: cancerscreening provide easy way download cancer screening data Kenya Health Information System (KHIS) using R. function begin prefix get_ followed screening area cervical breast. Goal allow download data associated data interest, e.g. get_cervical_screened, get_cervical_positive, get_cervical_treated. cancerscreening "pipe-friendly" , fact re-exports %>% require use. Please see cancerscreening website full documentation: https://cancerscreening.damurka.com/index.html addition function-specific help, several articles indexed : Article index

title: Retrieves Analytics Table Data from KHIS — get_analytics_formatted
text: element_ids vector data element IDs retrieve data. Required. start_date start date retrieve data. required format YYYY-MM-dd. end_date ending date data retrieval (default current date). level desired data granularity: "country" (default), "county", "subcounty", "ward", "facility". organisations list organization units ids filtered. ... options can passed onto KHIS API.

title: Retrieves Analytics Table Data from KHIS — get_analytics_formatted
text: tibble detailed information, including: Geographical identifiers (country, county, subcounty, ward, facility, depending level) Reporting period (month, year, fiscal year) Data element names Category options Reported values

title: Retrieves Analytics Table Data from KHIS — get_analytics_formatted
text: Retrieves data directly KHIS analytics tables. Supports optional arguments providing organization lists, data elements, categories. Allows specifying KHIS session objects, retry attempts, logging verbosity.

text: get_cervical_target_population() subsets target population cervical cancer screening: females aged 25 years 50 years get_breast_cbe_target_population() subsets target population clinical breast examination: females aged 25 years 74 years get_breast_mammogram_target_population() subsets target population breast cancer screening mammography: females aged 40 years 74 years get_colorectal_target_population() subsets target population colorectal cancer screening: males females aged 45 years 75 years target populations guided Kenya National Cancer Screening Guidelines 2018. population projection counties national level calculated based population growth 2.2% obtained Kenya National Bureau Statistics. annual targets follows guidance screening guidelines cervical cancer also guided publication 'Planning implementing cervical cancer prevention programs: manual managers.'

title: cancerscreening (development version)
text: release streamlines khisr package focusing core functionality: retrieving screening data MOH 745 screening tool. Refactored Functionality: Previously available functions retrieving data element metadata, organization unit metadata, formatted datasets migrated dedicated khisr package. enhances code organization avoids redundancy. New Function: ’ve introduced get_screening_reporting_analytics() function retrieve reporting metrics associated MOH 745 screening tool.

title: cancerscreening 1.1.0
text: CRAN release: 2024-04-14

title: cancerscreening 1.1.0
text: Updated get_data_elements_metadata() get_organisation_units_metadata() retrieve necessary data, enhancing performance. Introduced levels (country, county, subcounty, ward, facility) functions, allowing users specify scope data retrieval.

title: cancerscreening 1.1.0
text: Upgraded package utilize khisr package data retrieval. Renamed get_analytics() get_analytics_formatted() avoid conflicts khisr. Added get_data_sets_formatted() data set reporting metrics retrieval. Consolidated functionalities get_data_elements_metadata(): retrieves data elements, categories, removes need get_category_options_metadata(). Implemented functions retrieve laboratory diagnostics data: get_lab_fluid_cytology() get_lab_tissue_histology() get_lab_bone_marrow() get_lab_fna() get_lab_smears()

title: cancerscreening 1.1.0
text: Removed unnecessary elements categories parameters functions due optimized data retrieval. Repurposed organizations parameter control retrieved organizations using organization IDs.
